content: cloud gate ii finished measurements 40 bust 22 length from shoulder materials & needles toaga mohair/yarn 6 one 8 oz skein 490 yd available from dharma trading co size 15 straight or circular needles any length row counter gauge 8 sts and 11 row = 4 in stockinette stitch note even though i give apporoximate inch measurements for reference i recommend using row counts to measure length rather than inches it s hard to measure accurately using inches and the row are large and not hard to see back co 40 sts work k1 p1 rib for 5 row work stockinette stitch for 30 additional row 12 from beg bind off 2 sts at beg of next 2 row to mark armhole work stockinette stitch for 24 additional row 9 bind off all sts front co 23 sts work k1 p1 rib for 5 row slip first st of every rs row continue to sl the first stitch every rs row work stockinette stitch for 30 additional row keeping 4 sts at one side edge for front band bind off 2 sts at beg of next row to mark armhole at edge opposite the front band work 14 more row as set neck shaping decrease 1 st on inner edge of neck band stitches every rs row 4 times 17 sts when you ve worked 24 row 10 from armhole bind off work other front with opposite shaping sew shoulders of fronts to the back leaving 7 in center free the front sts will need to be eased in to fit the space sleeves pick up 20 sts on side edge between armhole bindoff and shoulder seam and 20 on other side 40 sts for sleeve this works out to 5 sts for every 6 row work in stockinette st for 42 row 15 next rs row k2tog k2tog k1 repeat across row 24 sts work k1 p1 rib for 5 row bind off loosely repeat for other sleeve finishing sew underarm seam of sleeves and side seams if desired work 1 row single_crochet across back neck to stabilize it block to measurements tips for working with big needles and mohair counting row hold your knitting up to a light it s easier to see the stitches when they re backlit joining yarn knots in mohair will come undone you can leave 3-4 tails and weave them in or knit with two strands for a few stitches to join the yarn beg= beginning co= cast on dp= double-pointed k= knit m1= increase 1 st invisibly p= purl pm= place marker round= round rs= right side sl1=slip 1 st slm= slip marker st= stitch ws= wrong side ©2019 dharma trading retail store 1604 4th st san rafael ca 94901
